scenes.location: TWA PLANE IN FLIGHT OVER LOS ANGELES NIG
characters: TINY TRANSISTOR AND STRAND OF WIRE
VIEW OF BATTLE FROM INT. BUBBLE
CARTER AND REID AT WINDOW OF CONTROL TOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the myriad lights of the city beneath it. As the pla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troop carriers filled with ARMED SOLDIERS are lined up be hangar; several official cars filled with SECRET SERVICE MOTORCYCLE POLICEMEN, and a caravan of three limousines c waiting entourage. The CHIEF of the SECRET SERVICE looks airfield as the plane is heard taxiing in. He turns and g of the limousines, followed by the others.

dialogues.speaker: VEHICLES ON AIRFIELD
dialogues.text: Coming toward camera. The plane looms in the f.g. A motor is on the way toward the door of the plane. The vehicles halt before the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Armed Soldiers leap out of the troop carriers and for around the plane. The Secret Service Men get out within t guards, wait for the door to open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It opens. GRANT steps out: in middle thirties, with the a who takes nothing seriously -- his coverup for involvemen to help JAN BENES out of the plane. Benes is Mittel Europ and manner. Physically, he is Schweitzer at forty: the le the shock of hair. He carries a battered suitcase. In res Grant's gesture, he precedes him down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FIELD
dialogues.text: As Benes reaches the last step, he is greeted by the Chie Secret Service, who shakes his hand, introduces him to se subordinates, and leads him to a limousine. Their words a the din of jets. About to get into the car, Benes turns a quickly to Grant, who is near the bottom of the stairs. B his hand. They shake warmly. Benes moves back toward the

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: He watches as Benes gets into the limousine and the carav with the Motorcycle Escort. The Soldiers are climbing bac troop carriers. Grant starts down the stairs, is lost to general activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down which the cavalcade speeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cavalcade races through an area of dark warehouses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rundown area. The cavalcade starts down the street. In floor of an otherwise dark house, a light is turned on an evident signal. PAN DOWN to a heavy car, waiting in a nar which opens into the street. Its headlights are off, the engine completely drowned by the concerted roar of the on and motorcycles. As the cavalcade nears the entrance to t of the motorcyles comes speeding up from the rear of the car in the alleyway starts toward the entrance to the all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car starts hurtling forward at full speed. The front limousine is now visible. A broadside impact seems inevit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcycle from the rear reaches the limousine as the comes hurtling out like a motorized projectile. It hits t -- a totally unexpected obstruction -- and sends the Poli out of scene. It is sufficient to deflect the kamikaze ca deadly aim. The car hits the rear of the limousine, sends out of control. The suicide car, also out of control, car the opposite side of the street. The limousine smashes in telephone pole, which brings it to a jolting stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The impact throws Benes to the side. His head hits the do with stunning force, almost knocking him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kamikaze car slams directly into a brick wall. It ins into fire, engulfing the Driver. The fitful flames illumi otherwise dark street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief of the Secret Service jumps out of the limousin sedan to pull up, his shouts lost in the general turmoil. Service Men are helping the dazed Benes out, shielding hi pulls up beside the limousine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief of the Secret Service instantly hustles Benes i As he climbs in beside him, and the other Secret Service the other side to get in, there is the sharp crack of a r shatters the rear window of the sedan, narrowly missing B Chief thrusts him onto the floor, sprawls on top of Benes him, while shouting to the Driver to get going, his words indistinguishable in the confusion of more rifle shots, w glass and bullets ricocheting through the interior of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the eerie light of the burning car, the sedan can be s off, flanked and spearheaded by Motorcycle Police. The Se Men and those in the sedans are left behind, firing towar floor of a nearby bullding from which the rifle fire came

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without divulging the nature of the hospital, the unconsc Benes is seen undergoing a fast and thorough medical prob TECHNICIANS and SPECIALISTS, using the latest equipment. machines, Centrifuges whirling blood samples, EKGs, Encep and a variety of instruments used in cerebral examination featured. After the LAST CREDIT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is late. A car is speeding along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated in the rear, Grant looks as if he has just been ar sleep and hustled into the car in a hurry. He is getting shirt, helped by a MAN beside him. There is a smudge of l his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry we had to get you up at this hour, Mr. Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yawning) I thought I was on my vacation... What's it all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you that either... Excuse me, Mr. Grant, but you've got a smudge on your cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out handkerchief, realizing Grant can't see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grant finishes buttoning on his shirt, the Man rubs of lipstick. Then he throws the handkerchief out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she said it was indelible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car bearing Grant pulls up on an unpaved parking area loading trucks. Nothing stirs. The DRIVER shuts off the e lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver and the Man in the rear get out. As Grant star

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're to stay inside, Mr. Grant. (answering look) And wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They close their respective doors, leaving Grant alone in looking out mystified into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men move off together, until they reach what they know is a proscribed distance from the car. Then they sto it. For a moment nothing happens, then the ground seeming sink with the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is startled to see the earth sliding up past the ca

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR SHAFT
dialogues.text: It now becomes apparent that the car has been resting on really the top of an elevator shaft. The sides of the sha visible: it is seemingly bottomless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant responds as the elevator finally comes to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is on the earthen platform. Two big doors open. A bearing the distinctive insignia of the <CMDF> appears, d M.P. wearing the same emblem. Grant gets out of the car, the M.P. into the scooter. He gets in, is driven away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass through a vast empty area, obviously capable of large pieces of equipment. The insignia of the <CMDF> is

dialogues.speaker: 43A RAMP
dialogues.text: The scooter carrying Grant speeds up the incline to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALE and FEMALE OFFICERS, all in the uniform of the <CMDF about busily. As the M.P. and Grant drive across the foye the Female CMDFs appreciatively. Their uniforms emphasize points. The scooter reaches:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OFFICER behind the desk looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your I.D. card, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant takes out a card with only an embossed number. The places it into an IDENTIFIER. We see its screen is blank. moment, Grant's picture flashes on in color, in full view The Officer looks up at Grant, sees it is an exact likene extracts the card. The screen goes blank. He hands Grant card. The scooter takes off, speeding down a long neon-li marked off for scooter traffic: four lanes, two in each d Numerous doors leading to offices open on both sides of t Traffic is heavy. Grant is the only one in mufti. The sco approaches doors over which lights flash:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the scooter nears the Sentry Box, the M.P. on duty hit The steel doors slide open. The scooter goes through into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENERAL ALAN CARTER is coming out of a door in a hurry. T bearing Grant pulls up beside him. Grant gets out. They s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Grant. Good to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pentagon, wasn't it, General? Only you weren't in that uniform...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move to window overlooking the OPERATING ROOM, see t unconscious Benes being wheeled in for Surgery. His head The full shock of hair stands out against the white pillo is draped in the usual manner. A battery of SPECIALISTS a ATTENDANTS, MALE and FEMALE, are moving about under the g focused on the Operating Table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Benes... What the devil happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Side got to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bad off is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brain injury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before or after what he wanted to tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he could breathe a word. He's the only scientist who knows the answer to what we're after. That's why we have to operate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away from the window, moves toward another door, following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and why we need you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: <Me>?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bewildered, he follows Carter through door into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter moves to a panel of many switches and TV screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't even put a Band-Aid on my finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the Surgeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flicks a switch. On the TV screen appears the INTERIOR OFFICE. We see DUVAL, a brain surgeon in the middle forti the manner of one totally dedicated to his work. At the m testing a ruby laser, narrowing the beam down to pencil-l Assisting him is CORA PETERSON. In the middle twenties, h attractiveness is matched by her efficiency, which is con They work together smoothly, the result of long associati evident neither know they are being observed during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duval. Dr. Peter Duval. Top brain man in the country. Ever hear of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, but I'm rusty on surgeons. Who's the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cora Peterson, his Technical Assistant. You'll join Duval and the others --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do? Except maybe pass out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter flips on another switch. On the TV screen appears OF DR. MICHAELS' OFFICE. It is dominated by big blowups o Circulation System. Michaels is asaembling charts, as if pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on loudspeaker) Mike...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels moves to a wall, presses a switch. His TV screen and Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet Grant. This is Dr. Michaels, Chief of the Medical Section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to have you with us, Mr. Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish I knew why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him where he fits in, will you? I've got a few things to check out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to another panell is seen throwing on switches, fast series of scenes, all of which are indistinguishable shot. Michaels is seen bustling about, collecting charts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need you for Security purposes, Mr. Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At an operation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know they failed to kill Benes. Security thinks they'll try again, first chance they get. We're afraid of medical sabotage -- or surgical assassination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surgical assassination?! But that means you suspect --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re-entering scene) [LINE OF DIALOGUE CUT OFF]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't agree. Just because he's often difficult --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Difficult? He's impossible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no reason to suspect him of disloyalty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why take the chance, when there must be other doctors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no choice. Duval's the most skillful brain surgeon in the country, and he's right here, at hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know if he's trying to save him or kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be standing by. <I'll> know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Grant) And no matter what happens, you're to take orders <only> from Dr. Michaels, understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come along, they'll be operating shortly. (hand on switch) See you later, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels waves. Carter switches off the monitor. He moves Grant follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they emerge:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His technician okay? In addition to the Looks Department?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No question of her loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carter leads Grant to the scooter and they take their looks at the big <CMDF> insignia on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to be inquisitive. But this <CMDF> -- for all I know it could stand for <Consolidated Mobilization of Female Delinquents>?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact) <Combined Miniature Deterrent Forces>.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blankly) Say that again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter starts the scooter and they drive through the big out of the Medical Foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can reduce anything down to any size we want. People -- ships -- tanks --planes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General, I've heard some wild ones. But this takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can shrink an Army -- with all its equipment -- and put it in a bottle cap. That's why we call it <Combined Miniature Deterrent Forces>.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with silent whistle) If the Other Side ever gets hold of a thing like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have... (answering look) But we've both got the same problem -- lack or control. We can only keep things Miniaturized for exactly sixty minutes. Arter that, everything starts growing back to its original size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the root of the escalator, leave the scoot the moving stairway.

dialogues.speaker: WITH ESCALATOR
dialogues.text: As they ride up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assume Benes knows how to control it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. He wanted us to have the secret, and not them. Which is why they tried to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're bound to try again. No wonder they want me to stand by during the operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And take a little trip with them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bewildered) Trip? Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact) Well, the only way to reach that clot is from inside the Brain. So we've decided to put a Surgical Team and a Crew into a submarine -- reduce it way down in size, and inject it into an Artery --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jolted) You mean <I'm> going along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As part of the Crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! They can't shrink <me>!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (assuringly) Grant, our Miniaturizer can shrink anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't want to be Miniaturized -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only for an hour --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even for a minute! General Carter, sir, I'd like you to reconsider your choice. I'm just not the right man for a mission of this kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts walking against the direction of the escalator, remaining in the same place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking his arm) Come on, Grant. You're going to a Briefing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have reached the top of the escalator. Nearby is a d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter opens the door, waves him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Carter enter in the middle of what is evidently argument between COLONEL DONALD REID and Duval. Reid is i of the <CMDF>, with a cadaceus which indicates he is the Division. Also present is CAPTAIN BILL OWENS, in Naval un Michaels. Cora stands beside Duval, rather abashed, since cause of the vociferous disagreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irascibly) Miss Peterson volunteered to come along!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did every male Technician in the Unit. A woman has no place on a mission of this kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brooking no rebuttal) I insist on taking my Technician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll take whoever <I> assign!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily) Don't tell me whom I'm to work with! Not on this operation or any other! I'll do what <I> think is best, without any interference from anyone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Reid can reply:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (diplomatically) Dr. Duval has relied on Miss Peterson for years. And since she wants to come along, I'm sure it's for the best, Dr. Reid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making best of defeat) I don't agree with you -- but since you're in charge, you can do as you please. But I want to go on record as being against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant -- Colonel Reid, Operation Commander. (they nod; of Michaels) You've met our Medical Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Michaels shake hands, in effect their first mee vis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Dr. Duval, our Head Surgeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, I've heard of you, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the attitude of the completely dedicated professiona throws him a cursory glance, nods, sits down, quickly ope folder containing the latest lab reports on Benes, which during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Peterson, his Technical Assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the charmer) How are you, Miss Peterson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She responds with an impersonal nod, sits down beside Duv up her sheaf of lab reports, handing him the pertinent on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Captain Bill Owens, designer of an experimental submarine for the Navy's 'Oceanographic Research and Development Program.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they shake hands:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of your element, aren't you, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes two of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant's uniquely qualified for this mission. He's a Communications Expert and was a Frogman during the War. Besides, he brought Benes into this country, and the fewer people who know about him, the better. At any rate, you'll find Grant invaluable, should anything go wrong once you're under way. (to Reid) Okay, Don.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the overall Target Area...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid presses a switch. A large anatomical map of a Brain central screen. The ganglia and dendrites form a network, intersecting roads, in a detailed war map. The clot is a obstruction in the center. Grid lines cross the map verti horizontally as points of reference. The entire projectio three-dimensional effect, since it is drawn in perspectiv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benes' brain...near as we can map it stereotaxically...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He switches on a flashlight arrow, points to the clot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clot's right here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He switches off the arrow and quickly flashes it on again on the edges of the map. The arrow now probes and with dr base, center and top of the brain, like the animated tech showing an attack which is repulsed at the perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible to get at -- (arrow makes vertical penetration to give impression of wide cut) -- without damage to the intervening tissue...which would prove fatal to Benes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses another switch. A startling OVERLAY OF THE BLO THE HEAD AND NECK appears over the anatomical drawing of encasing it. The red-colored arteries and blue-colored ve an intricate maze, that finding one's way through it seem impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way to reach it is via the Arterial System.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks at Cora. She is busy making notes from the pr Owens is showing no undue reaction, apparently having bee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phase One calls for Miniaturizing a submarine, with Crew and Surgical Team, and injecting it into the Carotid Artery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points with the arrow to the exact spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How small would that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the size of a microbe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, I'm sure that's quite a comfortable size, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reduced proportionately, you won't find it too strange --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All in a day's work, sure. But I was thinking of the speed of the Circulatory System.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About forty miles an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it seems to me if you reduce a ship to microscopic size -- and the stream remains constant -- we'd take quite a beating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very worried) I hope you've taken that into account --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't be going anywhere near that fast. We're putting Benes in deep Hypothermia -- that is, freezing him low as compatible with human life. It'll slow down his heartbeat, Circulation, and all other physical processes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens begins polishing his glasses, indicating his inner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even so, because of our size -- I mean lack of it -- we'll still be cruising mighty fast. We'll be smashed to bits if there's any turbulence --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing with flashing arrow) The only danger of turbulence is in the Heart -- and we're not going through it. (flashing arrow) Once in the Carotid Artery, we'll remain in the Arterial System... until we reach the point of damage -- (flashes around clot) -- where Dr. Duval will attempt to dissolve the clot with a laser beam. After the operation, we'll return by way of the Venous System -- (coursing down with arrow) -- until we reach the base of the neck -- (arrow stops) -- where we'll be removed right here -- with a hypodermic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will you know where the sub is, at any particular moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Michaels -- our Circulatory Specialist -- will serve as your Navigator. He'll know just where you are. And you can communicate directly with us, by wireless. Besides, the sub is nuclear-powered, and we'll be tracking it just as we would any radio-active tracer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll be a team of Surgeons standing by. We're prepared to remove you immediately, should anything go wrong. In any event, you must be out within sixty minutes. After that, you'll be in danger of attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attack? Who -- or should I say what from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benes' natural defenses. White Corpuscles -- Antibodies. Once you begin to grow -- and become a menace to the body -- you'll trigger them off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all the unknown factors in the body, I still say risking five lives for one is something we should reconsider --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We understand your concern, but we've made our decision, Doctor. Any questions? Anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one, General...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where can I get a cab back to town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one responds to the attempted levity. Carter rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to all) Proceed to the Sterilization Section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Reid move out of the room through the door. Th out through another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five appear and stop before a cylindrical door with h similar to those in a vault, to give the effect of a seal within. Over the door flashes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five reach the door. An electronic beam swings it ope automatically. They start in. As Grant moves past the sig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much can a man give to his country?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings automatically shut behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge plastic bubble in the form of a truncated semicirc glass panels overlooking areas not visible in the angle o TECNICIANS in the uniform of the <CMDF> are seated at a d bank of monitors, on a slightly raised platform. They are numerous TV screens for focus. A cacophony of B-Beeps fro underscores the sense of last-minute preparations. A COMM AIDE wearing headphones and throat microphone moves about crosses to the Miniaturization Control Panel. Reid goes t overlooking the OPERATING ROOM. Below, he can see Benes o operating table, a towel over his head. Surgical Aides ar last-minute check of the Thermal Blanket which encases hi sections. Reid presses a button on the wall beside the wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make the final preparations...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin to remove the towel from Benes' head. Reid tur the window and crosses to the window overlooking the MAIN With him we see a huge room, bisected by a floor-to-ceili map of the entire ARTERIAL and VENOUS SYSTEM from rib-cag to simulate the body of Benes in a prone position. Grid l areas in relation to true North and South. TECHNICIANS ar about with charts and reports which are coming in through telephones, teletypes, batteries of Computers, Oscillogra Encircling the entire floor are glass-fronted booths whic SPECIALISTS' POSTS. Reid turns to a Technician at the Mas Section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Technician) Heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Technician flips on a switch. On a TV screen appears OF THE HEART POST, one of the glass-enclosed booths looki the MAIN OPS ROOM. Like all the Specialists Posts, it is with its particular area and nothing else: Blowups of the great detail, X-rays of Benes' heart, its beat being reco electronically on a huge EKG chart which fills one wall a constant operation via remote control. The HEART SPECIALI standing before the EKG chart, while a TECHNICIAN twirls panel. Reid can be seen in the closed TV circuit in the H (As in all subsequent TV communications.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it look, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over TV) Holding steady at thirty-two per minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to another Technician) Respiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Technician flips on another switch. On a TV screen ap INTERIOR OF THE RESPIRATION POST. Here everything relates lungs. In addition to cut-away sections where each small the proportions of a detailed war map, there are banks of X-rays, lit up in panels, plus immense calibrated charts INHALATION and EXHALATION, on which the rate is being ele recorded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he doing, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lung Specialist is seen glancing at a chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over TV) Respiration is now six per minute... I wouldn't take him down any further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Technician flips switch in response to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hypothermia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a TV screen appears the INTERIOR OF THE HYPOTHERMIA PO festooned with dials recording bodily temperature, before TECHNICIANS sit watching and making minute adjustments. T HYPOTHERMIA SPECIALIST moves along, keeping a sharp eye o zones labeled: CIRCULATORY, RESPIRATORY, CARDIAC, RENAL,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any problems, Dr. Sawyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over TV) No sir. We're holding him at twenty- eight degrees Centigrade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter enters, moves to the Control Section to join Reid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do we stand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medical's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Communications Aide with headphones moves up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in the Sterilization Corridor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathed in eerie ultra-violet light. The five are passing corridor, in single file. All are dressed in khaki unifor moves ahead of Cora. As they reach a vestibule at the end swings open automatically. Grant starts to help Cora over threshold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me. I'm sterile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant grins. They move into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge parquet area, composed of white octagonal modules. center is the Zero Module, in red. Standing over it is a craft. The angle and the distance renders its details ind WHITE-CLAD TECHNICIANS wearing rubber gloves are seen wor it. As the five come into the room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on loudspeaker) Please board and check all your equipment immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up, see:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER AND REID AT WINDOW OF CONTROL TOWER
dialogues.text: They can be seen, high above.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN INTO MINIATURIZATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Carter and Reid look down at the tiny figures below as th toward:

dialogues.speaker: THE PROTEUS
dialogues.text: With Grant and the others, we now get the full impact of experimental sub at close range: sleek lines from the int nose sweep over a transparent plastic bubble atop the str then down to taper off at the stern under which are doubl sub is supported by cradles, allowing it to stand free of Plastic windows in the bow afford the occupants a full vi Clad Technician hands Owens a small lead box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the particle, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything aboard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All squared away, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carefully holding the lead box, Owens starts up the ladde by Duval, then Michaels. Grant waves Cora to precede him. the monk's steps above the ladder, climb upward, then one disappear through the hatch. Grant is the last one in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Grant we see the interior. There are plastic windows In the center is the Navigation and Communications kiosk, contains charts, reports, and a wireless set. Four swivel spaced about the kiosk. Behind it, a ladder leads to the Bubble above. Set in the rear of the kiosk is a watertigh leading into the escape hatch. Behind the kiosk is a Lab Section, not visible at the moment. No power of any kind lights or air-conditioning. The interior is illuminated b coming in through the plastic windows. Duval, Michaels an instantly move to the kiosk and busy themselves examining and reports in the numerous pigeonholes. Owens hands the Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant takes the lead box. Owens removes a crank from the inserts it into a hole in a circular trap door which read

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens turns the crank. The lid of the trap door opens. A comes up. Owens then opens the lead box by undoing two bu screws. He removes the Seed Cage from within the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not relishing thought) Atomic fuel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing you could see with the naked eye. But there's a microscopic radio-active particle inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the Seed Cage on the cradle and lowers it back be floor, by reversing the crank. During the above:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's no military secret, how can a sub run on a microscopic particle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't reduce nuclear fuel. But once the Reactor's Miniaturized -- along with the submarine -- a microscopic particle should emit enough energy to activate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cutting it mighty close -- for a perfect fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should work -- theoretically. If it doesn't, the mission's off. The craft's nuclear-powered. Except for your wireless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lid of the trap door is now level with the floor. Owe the crank, and taking the lead box from Grant, he puts bo the tool box during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking about; admiringly) All in all, quite a canoe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Designed for Piscatorial Research -- the Spawning Habits of Deep Sea Fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me to ask you about the love life of an octupus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the wireless, sees Cora smile as she goes thr door. Grant begins tapping out a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WIRELESS TECHNICIAN is writing down the message heard c tears it off his pad, hands it to the Communications Aide it to Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Test message from the Proteus, sir. (reading) 'Miss Peterson has smiled.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an auspicious sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confirm receiving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is at the wireless, logging the incoming message. I meantime, Owens finishes battening down the entrance hatc studying medical reports, Michaels is spreading out the f Navigation Charts, a very detailed map of the Vascular Sy Neck and Head. As Owens crosses on the way to the ladder the Bubble:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, how will you be able to follow my charts -- (of Bubble) --from up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the Repeater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels looks at him blankly. Owens flips a button up an hooded device which is trained on the chart area. The sma remains blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once the power's on, we'll be in direct touch. Come, I'll show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels moves with him to the ladder leading to the Bubb stops, waves him to continue. Michaels goes up the ladder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ultra-sophisticated set of controls, consisting of a p panel and an airplane-like steering wheel. The plastic af degree view of the Miniaturization Room. There is room fo person. Owens remains on the ladder, so that only his hea the Bubble. Owens points to the identical Repeater on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of controls; ironically) Looks simple to operate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down in the single seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is moving aft. With him we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Bubble; with pride) It actually is, although the controls are highly sophisticated. There's a button for everything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant enters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Originally designed for marine research, it still shows s pre-adaptation structure: there is a series of glass-fron compartments, now labeled ANTIBIOTICS, ANTI-COAGULANTS, C MED OXY, etc. A wide counter runs the length of the compa side, suitable for working on specimens. A Ruby Laser sit counter at the end, its plastic cover removed and to the other is a piece of metal on a metal base. As Grant enter Cora working with a set of very small tools, making minut on the laser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet you're pretty handy around the house... Can you cook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating oxy containers) We're pushing oxygen today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take some Laughing Gas, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) You sound as if you're not looking forward to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not exactly a pleasure cruise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's the most exciting -- (with awe) We're going to see things no one ever saw before. The actual physical process of Life itself -- not something under a microscope... Just think of it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the trouble. I am. Being shrunk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may learn to like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has finished adjusting the laser. She now lifts Grant from the metal disc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She presses a button on the laser. With startling suddenn pencil of light shoots out, cutting a hole through the me instantaneously. Had Grant's hand remained, the beam woul right through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a nice young lady, you play with the damndest toys, Miss Peterson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She adjusts the intensity and thickness of the laser beam one cutting different size holes through the metal during

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with smile) That'll teach you where to keep your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she drills metal through again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could be quite a lethal weapon... It could kill, not cure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the hands of a great surgeon like Dr. Duval. The beam of this laser can be regulated to one millionth of a millimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you've been Dr. Duval's Assistant for quite some time... He must've snatched you out of the cradle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been with him since I got out of school. He brought me into the CMDF, over five years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long time, with one man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not working for someone like Dr. Duval --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks off, realizing she may have revealed her feeli switches off the laser, averts looking at Grant as she fi plastic cover over it. Into the silence, the wireless is message comes in. Grant starts back into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thoughtful, listening to the wireless. Michaels is coming the Bubble. As Grant reaches the wireless, the tapping co end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud enough for all) 'Prepare for Miniaturization'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positions, please. And strap yourselves in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Duval begin putting on their safety harnesses, attached to their respective seats. Cora appears out of t compartment. Michaels moves toward it, a check-list in ha disappears within. In the meantime, Owens is busy tighten lock-screw in evidence.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE KIOSK
dialogues.text: Cora stops before Duval, tries to help him with the final getting into the harness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right -- I can manage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to leave, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with difficulty) Doctor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (busy with harness) Yes, Cora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- I want to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She falters as he looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? (anxiously) Anything wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the moment gone) I just wanted to thank you for taking me along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for volunteering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns abruptly, gets into one of the seats and starts her harness. In the meantime, Michaels appears from the a compartment, checking off a few items on the bottom of hi moves quickly to the kiosk. He places the list into a pig down, quickly straps on his harness.

dialogues.speaker: WITH OWENS
dialogues.text: Everything battened down, he now checks Cora's harness, t same with Duvalls and Michaels'. All are now sweating. Fi Grant's harness, Owens moves quickly up the kiosk ladder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens drops into the seat, and with the speed of much pra into his harness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and the others hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above, in Bubble) Okay, Mr. Grant. Tell them we're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grant begins to tap out message:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The message is coming in. The Wireless Technician writes it off the pad and the Communications Aide reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Proteus reports all secured.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Technician) Miniaturizer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TECHNICIAN at a panel marked <MIN> throws a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What appeared to be a solid wall at the end now slowly st apart, gradually revealing:

dialogues.speaker: THE MINIATURIZER
dialogues.text: A huge, honeycombed disc, suspended from a rail running a ceiling, begins to roll silently toward the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grant gets his first sight at what is going to shrink reacts quite convinced. He glances at Duval, Michaels and too, are looking at the oncoming Miniaturizer, but with n response. They apparently have seen it before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid and Carter are looking down at the M1niaturizer as i slowly toward the sub. When the disc is directly over the Techn1cian at the <MIN> panel throws a switch, instantly Min1aturizer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All stations stand by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Technician presses a button. There is the SOUND of a wa 110        MAIN OPS ROOM - P.O.V. The last minute scurry, as all take their respective plac OFFICER is seen moving up to the big center grid map of t System with something in hand which we can't distinguish

dialogues.speaker: 110D
dialogues.text: Now all are mobile, waiting at their machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid is now before the monitors, all of which are on. Car from the window overlooking the Miniaturization Room, loo The latter nods in silent affirmal. Carter turns to the C Aide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commence Miniaturization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into throat mike) Commence Miniaturization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottom of the Miniaturizer begins to glow with increa intensity. Simultaneously, the modules beneath the sub al light up with equal intensity. Gradually, the entire sub a blaze of incandescence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lack of ventilation and the tension is causing Grant others to sweat profusely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From his vantage point, Owens can see the light of the Mi reach the peak of intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light flashes on the <MIN> panel. With Carter we see a Technician's Control Panel as it becomes activated. Two b co-ordinates marked <MIN DIMEN> and <MIN SECS> flash on. at the monitors, eyes on the charts which keep flashing o Benes' temperature, heartbeat, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light is bathing the entire sub in an iridescent glow dull hum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Grant we get the first <subjective> realization that shrinking: the proportions of what he can see in the Mini Room are changing. He looks about him in a moment of wond

dialogues.speaker: DUVAL AND MICHAELS
dialogues.text: From their vantage points at the kiosk tower, they can se more of the outside than Grant. They respond like scienti intense absorption in the process.

dialogues.speaker: CORA
dialogues.text: She responds enthralled.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Up in the Bubble, he gets the unlimited view -- and he is For now the Miniaturizer stretches far, far up, and the h light from the Miniaturizer disc seems as distant as star of the room are barely discernible in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO GRANT
dialogues.text: The final subjective reaction as with him we see: 122        CONTROL TOWER - GRANT'S P.O.V. Far, far up, the windows of the tower have merged into a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now with Carter we get the first <objective> view of the Proteus as they watch it shrink down, down, down in the c Zero Module, which we see is laced with intersecting line sub reaches the size of a capsule about the length of a c Carter looks down at the grid on the Technician's Control sees the blips on the co-ordinates approach closer and cl they finally merge into one. He looks back at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights at the bottom of the Miniaturizer's disc go of stops. At this distance, the sub looks like a speck on th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elevate Zero Module.

dialogues.speaker: THE ZERO MODULE
dialogues.text: It starts to rise from the floor with the capsule-sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and the others respond as the vast parquet floor wi of hexagonal lines seemingly stretching into infinity sud dropping beneath them. The effect is that of becoming air

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Owens we get the unobstructed view: everything is fa far below. The bottom of the Miniaturizer seems an infini above.

dialogues.speaker: THE ZERO MODULE
dialogues.text: Still rising slowly.

dialogues.speaker: THE ZERO MODULE
dialogues.text: The capsule-sub is now about four feet off the floor, on The Zero Module comes to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All are sweating more profusely, showing increasing disco

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter turns from the window, looks at Reid, who glances viewing the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay to proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phase Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A panel slides open and a precision handling device is ro several WHITE-CLAD TECHNICIANS. A NURSE follows, in unifo machine is fourteen feet high, consists of pulleys on a t control a vertical arm angling down from a horizontal ext sets of mechanical fingers are on the vertical arm, about apart. Together they act as clamps. All adjustments are c various worm-gears. As the tall tripod rolls by, on the s base we see stamped: MIN PRECISION HANDLING, under the in <CMDF>.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and the others react to the first sight of the onco beings> in relation to their own reduced size: a button i shoe -- although far down from their position on the Zero long as a city street, the heads gargantuan atop skyscrap bodies. The precision handling machine itself is beyond r owing to its vast proportions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tripod is eased to a stop so that its vertical arm is over the Proteus on the Module. A TECHNICIAN at the gear turning a worm-gear control, which lowers the vertical ar capsule-sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant reacts as huge steel fingers at the bottom of the a slide into view. He glances at Cora and the others. They know what to expect, but watch with the interest of scien mechanical fingers slowly disappear beneath the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Technician maneuvers the mechanical fingers carefully slip under the cradle of the sub, in effect becoming its Once the steel fingers are in place, the Zero Module sink floor from view, while the tripod holding the Proteus is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Technician presses a switch.

dialogues.speaker: 138B CYLINDRICAL AMPULE
dialogues.text: A glass ampule about as tall and round as a small silo st up out of the floor on the Zero Module. The transparent c filled with a clear liquid, two-thirds to the top. It res encircling cork base. The lettering at the base reads: SA SOLUTION.

dialogues.speaker: CYLINDRICAL AMPULE
dialogues.text: Grant and the others react to what appears to be somethin illuminating gas storage tank -- albeit filled with liqui

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Carter we see the tripod with the Proteus brought to to the saline solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Technician at the tripod moves it so that the claw ho Proteus is directly over the water in the ampule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and the others react as they see themselves suspend appears to be a huge lake far below, bounded by cylindric walls in the distance. Reflected light bounces off the to water, with iridescent effect. Suddenly they begin to des and the others react as they seem to be dropping at suici toward the water which is rushing up to meet them as if t dive-bomber. Then as the surface nears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within the high walls of the ampule, the capsule-sub is d the water. Despite the delicate handling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It 'hits' the water, jarring all within, as at a launchin drydock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Technician now begins to maneuver the mechanical fing under the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and the others see the gigantic steel fingers slidi plastic windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lifting fork is now disengaged from the sub, which fl the ampule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub is rocking none too gently on the surface of the enclosed 'lake.' As Owens sees the ends of the immense pr past the bubble and continue upward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (down toward kiosk) We've got to submerge manually. Grant, open Valves One and Two on the bulkhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant slips out of his harness and moves quickly to a but marked <ONE> in the bulkhead. On the opposite side of the duplicate valve marked <TWO>. As Grant begins turning Val

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here -- I'll get the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duval gets out of his harness and moves to the second val watches him covertly while working at his own valve.

dialogues.speaker: 152A MICHAELS
dialogues.text: As he sees the fluid rising toward the bow windows, he be respond with increasing fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens' attention is on the gauges in the panel before him recording PRESSURE and DEPTH. The surface of the saline s begins to flood upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Duval at the valves, now fully open. Through th windows the water appears to move upward in relation to t continues submerging.

dialogues.speaker: 154A MICHAELS
dialogues.text: Face sweating, his eyes reflect growing irrational terror at the rising fluid bubbling over the bow windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the depth gauges near the <30> mark:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close valves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Duval twist the valves shut. When both are done

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valves closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Bubble) Right. That's all for the present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grant and Duval move to their seats, Michaels opens hi slips out and hangs onto the bulkhead ledge, gasping for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't breathe!... I've got to get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late now. We must go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll feel better once we're underway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels hangs on tighter to the bulkhead ledge, trying t himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) I -- I'm sorry... Claustrophia -- buried alive -- two days -- air raid -- England... Thought I'd gotten over it. Please -- forgive me... I'm quite all right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sinks back into his seat. Grant helps him with his har

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now see the sub for the first time beneath the surface saline solution: a small capsule submerged at an even kee fourth of the way down in the huge transparent container. on which the ampule rests now return to floor level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From his vantage point above, Carter can barely see the c ampule. He glances at Reid, who looks up from the monitor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Technician) Phase Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Technician presses a button on the <MINI> panel, acti <MIN> grid. The two blips flash on again, moving down the and <MIN SECS> co-ordinates.

dialogues.speaker: THE MINIATURIZATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Instantly the disc of the Miniaturizer trained on the amp glow again. The light is reflected on the entire surface solution. The low hum resumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again we first get the <subjective> view of the shrinking Grant and the others see everything rushing away into an distance. And all the time the reflected light which has the interior of the sub is diminishing. We see the reason

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The <objective> view: the ampule has shrunk way below the Miniaturizer. Its far smaller size reflects only a spark sub is now only a particle, shrinking with the ampule. Th and Nurse look on, grouped at the tripod which is beyond the Miniaturizer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sub shrinks to invisibility, disappearing before o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In its now fully reduced size, we see the ampule is actua cylinder about two inches long and half-an-inch in diamet

dialogues.speaker: MIN GRID
dialogues.text: With Carter we see the two blips merge and hold. Instantl in the Miniaturizer go off. The hum stops. A loud CLICK i look up at:

dialogues.speaker: ELECTRIC MINUTE RECORDER
dialogues.text: A big <60> flashes on, and holds. (NOTE: We will see the clock, in varying sizes, in every set, flashing on the pa in <minutes>, from now to the end of the picture.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Zero Module now begins to rise above floor level. The its reduced cork base, appears very tiny from this height

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Wireless Operator) Inform Proteus they are at Full Reduction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Technician taps out the Proteus' call letters. All wa for a response, as the tapping stops. They react, relieve hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant tapping out reply. Now, for the first time, we get <microscopic> view of what all see from their various van distorted through liquid and the glass walls. The light i are finding it very hard to breathe in the unventilated c the incoming message stops:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [LINE OF DIALOGUE CUT OFF]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens glances at his wrist watch. Then he flips a switch. the buttons on his panel. None light up. There is an anxi Then the myriad lights on the panel begin to glow dully. Recorder on the panel begins to flash <59>.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights become brighter. Cora, Duval and Michaels reac relief. The ventilators come on, permitting all to breath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buttons on the panel are now aglow. Owens makes a tes a button which spins his seat, with the control panel bef complete 360 degree turn within the Bubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a brief message is heard coming in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proteus On-Power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With relief, Carter turns to Reid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all yours, Don.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid moves from the monitors, presses a button on the Con

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Technicians at the tripod hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) Phase Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Technicians move the tripod so that the vertical arm directly over the ampule and lowered, until the two sets fingers clamp the cylinder firmly. Then the ampule is rai inches from its position on the module. The reduced cork encases the bottom. The Nurse and a Technician move to th holds a small instrument case.

dialogues.speaker: AT AMPULE
dialogues.text: When they reach the clamped ampule, the Technician opens Nurse takes out a plunger. Very carefully, she begins to into the top of the ampule without disturbing the liquid. gently pulls away the cork remaining at the base of the a revealing a small opening in the center. But owing to the above, the liquid does not run out. She takes a needle ou and carefully fits it into the nipple. We now see the amp actually a hypodermic syringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ried and Carter watch as the tripod is carefully wheeled room.

dialogues.speaker: THE HYPODERMIC NEEDLE
dialogues.text: The saline solution in the cylinder is sloshing slightly, great care of those moving it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub is being rocked, causing everyone to hold on for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens is trying to keep an even keel with his controls, n operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As two big doors slide open for the tripod to pass throug

dialogues.speaker: RADIAL LINES
dialogues.text: What appears to be a myriad number of radial lines crossi to form tiny squares over a domed surface is revealed to

dialogues.speaker: BENES' HEAD
dialogues.text: Now shaved clean, the head is grid-marked for Stereo-ence measurements. In the background, the tripod is seen being

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving with the hypodermic needle clamped in the tripod, the full impact of the set: the floor is marked off for T South, with latitudinal and longitudinal lines. The moder table is set so that Benes' head corresponds with the exa of the Arterial Head on the big grid map in the Main Ops is lying under a thermal blanket, covered up to the colla rubber pipes lead out from the blanket to the Central The under the operating table, out of the way of everyone. A GAUZE-MASKED SURGEONS AND ASSISTANTS stand grouped around unconscious patient. In a semi-circle at the head of the the head, is a series of SMALL TRACKING DEVICES resemblin telescopes. They are remotely controlled. The Minute Reco prominent position now changes from <59> to <58>.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid and Carter are looking on. The Communications Aide s side. They see the clamped hypo rolled up to the side of and brought to a gentle stop.

dialogues.speaker: BENES AND HYPO
dialogues.text: A small circle marks the exact spot of the injection. A S swabs the area with alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: ACTIVATOR
dialogues.text: It is brought down mechanically by use of worm-gears on t toward the plunger, engaging it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid, watching the proceedings below:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Wireless Operator) Contact Proteus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant takes down the message as it comes in. When message

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud enough for Owens in Bubble) Stand by for injection!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the sub begins to rock hard. All hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens is manipulating controls, trying to keep an even ke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hypodermic is being angled by the precision gears of for the exact degree of injection. When this is accomplis

dialogues.speaker: BENES' NECK
dialogues.text: The point of the needle approaches the exact spot, which marked off by a tiny cross within the circle on the Arter

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN AT TRIPOD
dialogues.text: He presses the mechanical activator which sends the needl into Benes' neck O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly a warning klaxon goes off. It keeps on for a fe then stops. Into the silence:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Technician flips a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four TECHNICIANS are seated before their radar screens, w flat electronic lines, except one. This is picking up a b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Technician at the Control Panel throws on a switch. Ano screen next to the Main Monitor goes on, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: BLIP ON TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: Duplicating the blip seen in the Tracking Post. We see th heading down, at an angle identical with that of the hypo MOVES IN on the blip, and keeps moving until it fills our screen and becomes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diving at a terrific speed, steeply angled like the hypo, clear saline solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hold on as if riding a roller coaster at its steepest Suddenly all goes pitch-dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the buttons are glowing, and the Minute Recorder, wh <57>. Owens throws a switch. Through the plastic windows headlights of the sub are seen coming on. They pierce the sufficiently to catch the side of the steel wall of the n is rushing past at a tremendous speed, giving the effect enclosed channel. The beams gradually reveal:

dialogues.speaker: HOLE OF NEEDLE
dialogues.text: A small aperture in the distance, barely visible.

dialogues.speaker: 196A HOLE OF NEEDLE
dialogues.text: Grant and the others see the opening at the end of the ne bigger and bigger, apparently rushing toward them with gr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It fills the screen, an immense aperture in relation to t which suddenly comes shooting out of it.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN OPS ROOM
dialogues.text: Reid and Carter observe the Grid Officer, wearing headpho throat mike, move up to the Arterial Map with a tiny repl Proteus. He places it in the center or the huge channel i which depicts the Carotid Artery. The little sub is held on the grid. The Minute Recorder now reads <56>. Reid tur window, moves to the Map Case, which contains the same as charts as in the sub's kiosk. Reid takes out an OVERLAY M HEAD AND NECK. He places it on a Radarscope. The blip sho traveling up the Carotid Artery.

dialogues.speaker: ESTABLISHING
dialogues.text: The headbeams of the speeding sub reveal a world of dazzl beauty: the Arterial Stream. The walls of the vast amber- chamber are lost in the distance. Now the screen is fille floating wonderland: huge red corpuscles, whirling globul platelets, particles, minuscule fragments drift with the reflecting the entire spectrum of color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens is slowing down the sub. He gazes in awe at:

dialogues.speaker: ARTERIAL ELEMENTS
dialogues.text: As the Proteus moves through the swirling conglomerations elements are parted, flow over the sub, bounce about it, fluid galaxies in a universe of amber. And each grouping regrouping, every mass and disc, though loosely linked, h of its own>. Thus the Corpuscular drift, the bouncing par parting and the merging achieve a majestic choreography l quality, a fugue of motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Cora, strapped in their seats, look on enthrall sheer beauty of the dancing wonder-world visible through Duval appears equally moved. Michaels observes with more detachment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens has now slowed down the sub so that it moves slight than the current, thus enabling him to maintain maneuvera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may unfasten your belts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, Cora and Duval quickly slip out of their harnesses bow for a maximum view of the scene. Michaels remains at checking their course on the Neck and Head chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching camera, with the three people looking out of windows in speechless wonder at what they behold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment the three gaze in silent awe at the dancing directly outside: nuclei are clearly visible in the cells tiny organisms sweep like cosmic dust through the orbits spinning globules. Their first sight of the interior worl beauty and rhythmic splendor has affected them deeply. Fi breaking the silence:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, as he looks on) The Medieval Philosophers were right... <Man> is the center of the Universe... We stand in the middle of Infinity, between Outer and Inner Space. And there's no limit to either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Inner Space is endless?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything can be divided in half, no matter how minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the concept sinks in, Grant turns to look out again. C taken her eyes off what she sees through the bow windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never...never imagined it could be anything...like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (equally awed) I always thought it was nothing but red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only to the naked eye. (indicating) Those corpuscles -- carrying oxygen -- give the stream its color. But the rest of the plasma's very much like sea water. An ocean of life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a piece of plumbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End-to-end, a hundred thousand miles long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant reacts. Of something up ahead:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Duval -- what could those be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub is suddenly engulfed by a mass of very tiny discs like combinations, which blot out the rest of the stream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now the scientist) Never saw <that>. Not even under an electron-mrcroscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're much smaller than bacteria...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the molecular structure of proteins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) I don't agree. I think we ought to stop and take a sample.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the purpose of this mission. (up at Owens) Captain -- keep a straight course -- until you're in the clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steering by instruments, Owens remains on course, the mas obstructing his view. Suddenly they float off, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arterial Wall to the right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With him we see:

dialogues.speaker: ARTERIAL WALL
dialogues.text: Barely visible in the spill of light, a smooth endothelia seen in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels consults his chart, brings the co-ordinates into two Arteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (up at Bubble) What's our speed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Bubble) Fifteen knots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels makes a rapid calculation with his slide rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should reach the Branching Artery in two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He switches on the REPEATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same REPEATER device is now active on the panel, refl chart on the console below, with Michaels' navigational c pointing to the intersect1ng Artery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from below) Keep the Wall at its present distance when you turn. That'll bring you safely into the middle of the Branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It cruises for a moment through the dazzling elements, th Wall in the distance. Then suddenly the sub accelerates a course toward the Arterial Wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens reacts, tries to slow down the sub and steer it bac middle of the channel. But the speed increases, and the s being swept toward the Wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and the others respond to the ever-increasing speed nearing Wall. They turn to Michaels, who, too, is aware o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain -- correct your course -- and speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Increasingly concerned as he works the controls and glanc gauges:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't respond! We're in some sort of current!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duval moves to Michaels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bewildered) But that isn't possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in a sealed vessel like an Artery. (up at Owens) Captain -- something must be wrong with your controls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Bubble) No -- it's a current! It's too strong -- I can't break out of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens is trying to gain control of the sub. It begins to Startled, Owens peers out, trying to determine the cause, beams reveal nothing ahead but an iridescent swirl of Art elements which bounce back the light. The buffeting incre The Arterial Wall is clearly visible to the side, getting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Cora exchange startled looks as the membranes o Arterial Wall suddenly become visible in the spill of lig headbeams: its connective strands arch Gothic-like, lost darkness of the vaulted enclosure. The vibrations have no so that all must hold onto stanchions for support.

dialogues.speaker: DUVAL AND MICHAELS
dialogues.text: Gripping the console for support. Through the plastic win side they can see the Arterial Wall looming with menacing They look at each other, unable to fathom the cause of th vibrations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens is desperately trying to avoid a head-on collision Wall, but the sub won't respond to any of his manipulatio looms closer, the buffeting is worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smashing into the Wall directly ahead seems inevitable. N connective strands almost fill the windows. Cora closes h anticipation of the fatal impact. And just when a collisi inevitable, the sub veers, narrowly missing the cable-lik thick enough to support a bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Owens we see the sub swept close alongside the Wall. evident the craft is out of his control, and that whateve collision has nothing to do with his attempt to steer it. mass of particles up ahead begins to part. The vibrations

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant reacts as he sees the now-visible area ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whirlpool!... Strap yourselves in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Cora, and against the buffeting, moves quickly t toward her seat. Duval and Michaels instantly take their console, begin getting into their harnesses.

dialogues.speaker: THE WHIRLPOOL
dialogues.text: Owens is appalled as in the distance, in the center of th sees what appears to be an immense liquid centrifuge rota speed, the Arterial elements within it whipped about like of a mixmaster. Now the buffeting is reaching its climax. inexorably approaching the rim of the whirlpool, with Owe desperately trying to steer away from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duval and Michaels are in their harnesses.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT AND CORA
dialogues.text: Slowed up by the intense buffeting, Grant is now helping seat. But before he can assist her into the harness, the in the whirlpool. The instant effect is that of a Carniva centrifugal force flings Cora out of her seat against the Grant is spun around and slammed against the opposite par bulkhead, and then onto the floor, with stunning impact.

dialogues.speaker: DUVAL AND MICHAELS
dialogues.text: Pinned back in their seats, unable to get out and help as

dialogues.speaker: GRANT AND CORA
dialogues.text: Helpless in the whiplike rotation, Cora is thrust from th onto the floor. Grant manages to grab a stanchion, hold o free hand he reaches out for Cora, now prone on the floor her hand, but a foot separates them. They desperately rea each other as the centrifugal force pulls them farther an apart... Grant takes the only possible chance or reaching go of the stanchion which sends him slamming against the seat. He grips the leg of the seat with one hand and grab waist with the other, just in time to prevent her from ag flung against the bulkhead. She holds onto him with all h Grant strains to maintain his grip on the leg of the seat free hand, which in effect holds them both against the ce whipping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens, too, is thrust back in his seat, powerless to move completely at the mercy of the whirlpool. A gauge on the registering in circles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rotating at great speed, a tiny piece of flotsam caught i cataclysmic force which is inexorably spinning it toward

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPALS
dialogues.text: Reacting to the ROAR of the massive turbulence and the wh stream, which is seen through the windows. The centrifuga them pinned to their positions, with Grant holding onto C before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is whipped around and down in the final circle -- and through the rapidly rotating center...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The steeply angled dive causes greater strain on Grant as grip on Cora. Duval and Michaels are now thrust forward a were in a gondola of a shoot-the-shoots making its steepe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a similarly forward-tilted position, with Owens we see whipping by in a seemingly endless drop. And then ahead t appears: 234        LONG SHOT - FISSURE IN ARTERIAL WALL - P.O.V. An immense crack through which some red corpuscles are st eddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From their prone positions on the floor, Grant and Cora r huge fissure looming through the windows. Duval and Micha looks, suddenly realizing what it signifies. Now the imme directly ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the tiny sub is swept out into the stream, where the b corpuscles are. Through the crack, a stream of red corpus whipping by on the other side. The angle of the dive now oblique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub is caught in a less turbulent current, which resu gradually losing its angle and speed, permitting Owens to away from the center toward a more placid area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
