dialogues.text: The sub is now level, moving much slower. Exhausted from Grant sees it is safe to let go of Cora. He helps her ris dazed at the bluish stream. Duval and Michaels, equally s to get out of their harnesses.

dialogues.speaker: BENES' NECK
dialogues.text: PAN over to the Miniature Tracking Devices.

dialogues.speaker: 238B TWO RADAR SCREENS
dialogues.text: The blip goes from one machine to the other, where it doe The Tracking Technician reacts, instantly presses a butto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warning buzz from a TV Monitor. Reid and Carter respond SOUND. The Communications Aide comes over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proteus Off Course, sir. They've picked up a blip in Quadrant 23, Level B. Reid moves quickly to the window overlooking the Main Operations Room, followed by Carter.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN OPS ROOM
dialogues.text: Both see the Grid Officer below move the replica of the s Carotid Artery to another channel near it within a quadra The channel is outlined in blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jolted) They've crossed over into the Jugular Vein!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That can't be -- there's no direct connection between the two --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally not. Unless it's an Arterio-Venous Fistula --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, Cora and Duval are grouped around Michaels at the distance, the endothelial walls of the Jugular Vein are v visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blankly) A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A forced joining of an Artery and Vein. Must've happened when Benes was hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, a fistula too small to show up on the X-rays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But big enough for us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the stream outside, the bluish corpuscles are increasi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (up at Bubble) Captain -- head back into the Artery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if it were a suicidal order:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brooking no argument) We could never fight that current it's physically impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from below) Then don't drift down further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do what I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he manipulates the controls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we can't go back, is there an alternate route?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... We can go forward on this course, but it means going directly through the Heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens is appalled as he sees the route being traced on th down the Jugular Vein toward the Heart. Before it can go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) We can't do that! We decided in the Briefing -- the craft could never stand the turbulence!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels looks up from the chart, to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it would be a hundred times worse than the whirlpool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others respond with grim realization of what it porte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just dandy. We can't go forward -- and we can't go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid there's only one thing we can do. Call off the mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotionally) Doctor...you can't mean that! Not when we've come this far. And if we give up, there'll be no way of saving Mr. Benes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Michaels is right. We have no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Grant) Tell them to take us out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's any chance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an order) Request removal, Mr. Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grant moves to the wireless:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Reid are looking down into the MAIN OPS ROOM a of the Proteus. It is in the same position as last seen i Vein on the big grid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we have no choice! We've got, to take them out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamantly) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away from the window as a message is heard comin seeming unawareness of the incoming message, Carter looks Minute Recorder, It is flashing <51>.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still have fifty-one minutes. Leave them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's hopeless! They can't go back and they can't go on. I tell you there's nothing else we can do but remove them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the final word) Not until the very last second. We must think of something... Something to save the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The incoming message stops. The Communications Aide takes Wireless Technician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) Proteus reports trapped in Venous System. Requests removal, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there it is... What do I tell them, General?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter turns his back on him, moves to the window, stands on the OPERATING ROOM. The scene below is almost a tablea the moving Miniature Tracking Devices. The Surgical Team table stands watching, waiting. Benes lies motionless. Re Carter. As they both look down at the patient, whose only life is now in their hands:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) Doctor...without killing him -- how long could we stop his heart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The less time, the better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. But what's the maximum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his comatose state...and everything slowed down...no more than sixty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter takes out a slide rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he figures) At topspeed...and adjusting distance for Degree of Miniaturization -- (getting answer) The sub should get through the Heart in fifty-seven seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would give us only three seconds to revive him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the problems in stopping the Heart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing -- compared to starting it up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the window, Carter can see the big Minute Recorder i Operating Room flashing from <51> to <50>.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're wasting time, Colonel. Let's get on with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The decision made, Reid takes command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Technician) Heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technician presses monitor button. As Carter moves to the Communications Aide, the HEART POST flashes on the TV scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Heart Post) <Cardiac Red Alert> we're stopping the Heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Communications Aide) Message to Proteus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now both give their orders simultaneously. As Reid speaks the HEART POST swing into action on the TV screen: the bi Benes light up on panels, a CATHODE TUBE recording his he becomes activated. The Heart Specialist and several Heart are seen leaving the POST. Meanwhile, the Communications taking down Carter's message for transmission. CARTER                                        REID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are heading in the                         An Arterio opposite direction of the                forced the Prote Target Area, as a result of                Venous System. crossing over into the Jugular        it is in the Latera Vein. Since you are in a                Region, anterior closed system, you will have                anterior to t to go through the Heart and                Plexus. The ha proceed on your mission by                the Venous Syst taking an alternate route. We                absolutely m will stop Benes' Heart for                would be fatal exactly sixty seconds.                        decrease th Maintaining maximum speed, you        Hypothermic means. will get through in fifty-                minimize the tu seven seconds. That will give                will have to us three seconds to spare in                The Proteus w which to revive him. Stand by                the entrance for exact instructions --                Atrium --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid's Voice is heard as the Heart Technicians rig Benes shock with a Cardio-Verter. They are removing the top thi Thermal Blanket. When his chest is exposed, they apply el it. Then the Technicians take their places at the various Instruments which are recording the pulse and configurati heartbeat. The last is visible on the big cathode tube of Cardioscope, a replica of which was seen in the Heart Pos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All are listening to Grant reading the end of the message

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- at which point the Heart will be stopped by electric shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the silence) And if it should take more time to get through --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) We can't take a second more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (up at Bubble) Captain -- head in the d1rection of the flow and drift with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out a detailed Cardiac Map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the Repeater, Owens can see Michaels spread the C He reacts to its great complexity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never find my way through that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll guide you, once we're in the Heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drifting down the Jugular Vein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grid Officer can be seen moving the replica of the Pr the Jugular Vein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Reid are looking down at Benes in the OPERATIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benes is now rigged for electric shock. The Tracking Devi concentrated on his chest. The Heart Specialist looks at Cardioscope Screen. The big screen registers the beat of with a cathode-tube effect, each pulsation causing an ele pattern. They are very slow, regular. The Heart Specialis of his Technicians who wears headphones. The latter press

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warning buzzer SOUNDS. The Communications Aide moves up Carter at the Tracking Station Monitor and Radarscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for Cardiac Shock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid nods, acknowledging the message. As he removes the m Radarscope, Carter takes out an OVERLAY MAP OF THE HEART Case and places it on the Radarscope. The blip is seen pr down the Vena Cava, leading to the entrance of the Heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pressing button) Stand by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter takes out a stop watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and the others respond as they begin to hear the SO distant boom-boom, slow and measured. It has an ominous e quickly gets louder during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in awe) Listen...the Heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...slowed down agreat deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like heavy artillery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It lays down quite a barrage in a lifetime. Forty million beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) And every beat separates a man from [LINE OF DIALOGUE CUT OFF]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of the Heart is now very loud, each measured bo artillery in a relentless barrage. The headbeams illumina passage, the walls of which are lost to view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and the others look on ahead, responding to the now beat, which increases as they near the source in the blui And then they react with wonder as they see:

dialogues.speaker: TRICUSPID VALVE
dialogues.text: In the distance, three huge membranes are billowing open, tendrils resembling supporting strands of parachutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parachute-like membranes are at the end of the Atrium entrance of which the sub now approaches. As the membrane fully, with a lovely effect, a big aperture is revealed. causes a big forward surge of the stream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hold onto whatever is at hand as the sub is swept onw with the tidal wave. Now in the distance they can see:

dialogues.speaker: TRICUSPID VALVE
dialogues.text: It is beginning to close, the three membranes seemingly c like three parachutes over the aperture. The boom of the is massive, making any communication very difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the sound; up at Bubble) Captain! They'll stop it on the next beat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens at the controls, eyes on the now-closed membranes,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from below) As soon as the Valve opens again, go through and give it everything you've got!

dialogues.speaker: TRICUSPID VALVE
dialogues.text: The sub approaches the now seemingly solid wall. Owens st to where he last saw the aperture. The closed membranes l and closer, the headbeams illuminating the delicately thr strands. Suddenly, the three membranes start billowing op

dialogues.speaker: THE CARDIOSCOPE SCREEN
dialogues.text: The electronic pattern is recording the beat.

dialogues.speaker: THE CARDIO-VERTER AND TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: He immediately presses the triggers on two electrodes hel Benes' chest.

dialogues.speaker: AMPERE NEEDLE ON CARDIO-VERTER
dialogues.text: The needle swings over into the red zone.

dialogues.speaker: THE CARDIOSCOPE SCREEN
dialogues.text: The electronic pattern indicating the heartbeat instantly and remains so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens is throwing on the full-speed-ahead control. The so Heart has completely stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surge from the twin jets as the sub is propelled forwar tremendous burst of power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hang on against the acceleration.

dialogues.speaker: PROTEUS IN TRICUSPID VALVE
dialogues.text: As it sweeps through the now-motionless membranes which w the stream, with no life of their own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense silence pervades. The Heart Specialist and his Te concentrate on the various instruments. The Surgical Team immobile.

dialogues.speaker: DEVICES
dialogues.text: The little cones are the only things that move in the Ope As they weave back and forth:

dialogues.speaker: STOP WATCH
dialogues.text: Calibrated in seconds. The hand is now crossing <5>.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the silence, Carter looks up from the stop watch in ha with the big radar screen. Moving across the OVERLAY MAP is a blip, indicating the sub's passage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing through a subterranean channel partially illuminat headbeams: a forest of tendrils, connecting huge roots wh chordae tendineae extending into the walls. The color of predominately blue, and the overall effect is that of a w wonderland. As the sub surges ahead at top speed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stands rooted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blip has crossed more than half the distance. Carter on, tense. The Proteus moves further down the Ventricle. glances at his stop watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-four seconds left including the three to revive him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels is anxiously scanning the way ahead for signs of There is none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above) Nineteen seconds, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Semi-Lunar Valve should be on our left any time now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid and Carter are tensely watching the Heart Map Overla time runs out and the sub is nearing the end. Carter look watch. It now shows only fifteen seconds to go, which mea be out in twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Heart Specialist is watching the blip nearing the end Screen, with time running out. The Heart Technician stand the Cardio-Verter stands immobile, looking at the needle Zero Amperes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing at top speed through the immobile forest of tendri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, off to the side, Grant sees a small opening, ha shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fasten yourselves in. There should be a tremendous surge when the Heart starts up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it does...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant throws him a look as they quickly start to get into harnesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steering for the opening, Owens glances at the Second Rec panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight seconds left --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On edge, Reid and Carter are watching the blip on the OVE THE HEART on the Radarscope. If the sub makes it, it will in 57 seconds. There are now only six seconds left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All are focusing on the Radarscope. Five seconds left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Technician at the Cardio-Verter is set to press the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Reid hold their breath as they see:

dialogues.speaker: STOP WATCH
dialogues.text: It now reads <56>.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLAY MAP OF THE HEART
dialogues.text: As the blip approaches the Semi-Lunar Valves, a warning b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A finger presses it.

dialogues.speaker: PULSE RATE NEEDLE ON CARDIO-VERTER
dialogues.text: It swings over, recording the first shock.

dialogues.speaker: CARDIOSCOPE SCREEN
dialogues.text: The cathode tube registers nothing.

dialogues.speaker: HEART SPECIALIST AT CARDIO-VERTER
dialogues.text: Concerned, he never takes his eyes off the Cardio-scope S increases the pulse rate.

dialogues.speaker: CARDIOSCOPE SCREEN
dialogues.text: It still records nothing. The Heart Technicians and the S exchange tense looks. Again the Heart Specialist increase rate.

dialogues.speaker: PULSE RATE NEEDLE ON CARDIO-VERTER
dialogues.text: As it swings over, recording a higher and higher output.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathed in weird St. Elmo's fire as it keeps racing toward

dialogues.speaker: SEMI-LUNAR VALVE
dialogues.text: which suddenly dilates into a huge opening. And with it c immense surge of the stream from behind, and the first bo Heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is swept through the Semi-Lunar Valve and into:

dialogues.speaker: ORIFICE OF PULMONARY ARTERY
dialogues.text: Out of which the Proteus is thrust on a great tidal wave stream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The electronic pattern is on full -- a leap of life. The Specialist and the others react with relief as now the EK other instruments begin recording Benes' return from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid and Carter are at the window overlooking the OPERATI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proteus in Quadrant 161 Level E...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave the window and walk over to the one where they MAIN OPS ROOM. They see the Grid Officer is moving the ti the wide channel leading to the Lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in the Pulmonary Artery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll make up some time, once they get through that and reach the Pleural Cavity. (to Technician) Respiration Post...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor next to Reid, a Technician flashes on the THE RESPIRATION POST. The calibrated charts marked INHALA EXHALATION indicate the return to breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his rate, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over TV) Back to six per minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid reaches out, knocks a cup of coffee off the Central Section, spilling it on his trousers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. And I just had them cleaned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is now flowing down to its normal speed. Through the s endothelial walls, we see the outlines of what appears to mammoth conduits arching above and beneath the channel th the sub is proceeding. Smaller conduits divide and subdiv circular immensity, to be lost in the distance. The effec a multi-level series of Over and Underpasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All are out of their harnesses. Grant, Duval and Cora are windows, looking out. Michaels is at the console, plottin position on a detailed Map of the Lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd hate to get lost on that Freeway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all lead to the same place -- the Lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the light of the headbeams, Owens can see the Walls be increasingly narrow and more transparent. He glances at h sees the Lung Chart reflected, with the co-ordinates pinp position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor -- the channel's getting awful narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from below) We're entering a Capillary. Remain in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fascinated) The Wall's transparent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from below) It's less than one ten-thousandth of an inch thick. And porous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant reacts as he sees a peculiar phenomenon: the big-bl corpuscles which stream past the submarine are turning br instant they impinge against the Capillary Wall. They kee in a constant flow, taking on their new color during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed) Look at that...they're changing color...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrilled) Doctor -- is it possible? That we're seeing it happen before our eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Yes, Cora... We're the very first to see the <living> process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look out, too deeply moved to speak. Atter a mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind letting me in on what's going on out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple exchange, Mr. Grant. Corpuscles releasing carbon dioxide -- the moment they touch the Wall of the Lung -- in return for oxygen coming through from the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me they're refueling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost in a reverie) Oxygenation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cora turns to look at him, feeling close in this shared m too, is moved by Duval's manner. Michaels glances up from Map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still gazing out) We've known it exists -- even though we never saw it...like the structure of the Atom... But to actually behold one of the miracles of the Universe -- the engineering of the Cycle of a Breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is too moved to continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the silence) Nothing miraculous about it. Just an interchange of gases. The end product of five hundred million years of Evolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't believe all that's accidental? That there isn't a Creative Intelligence at work --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Michaels can answer, they hear a warning buzzer SO Bubble above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buzzer is going while a red light is flashing on the looks startled at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The indicator is dropping rapidly toward a red horizontal delineating the danger level. Owens flicks the button off rapidly, as if testing the mechanism, but the indicator k dropping. He shuts off the buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imperatively) Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All look up toward the Bubble, at the urgency of his tone from the bow toward the console during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Skipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trom Bubble) We're losing pressure in the Flotation Tanks. Check the Manual, right over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant can see him pointing to the Manual Control Section of the kiosk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves quickly to:

dialogues.speaker: MANUAL CONTROL SECTION
dialogues.text: Over a series of controls are numerous gauges. The indica TANK RT and TANK LT show the left tank is rapidly losing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (up at Bubble) The left tank's losing pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens presses a button and swivels around. With him we se

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STERN OF PROTEUS
dialogues.text: A stream of large air bubbles is pouring out behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, Owens presses the button which swivels him back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant! Get up here, quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts getting out of his harness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grant moves toward the Bubble, he passes Duval and Cor now looking toward the stern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with apprehension) Air bubbles!... Doctor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No danger of an embolism. At our reduced scale, they're much too minute to prove fatal to Benes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grant appears, Owens is slipping out of his harness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a short in the valve. Take over. (of controls) Steers like an airplane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant nods as he gets into the seat. Owens starts quikly kiosk, leaving Grant at the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cora and Duval, at the window, watch anxiously as Owens m Manual Control Panel. Michaels remains at the console, al concerned. Owens opens the Circuit Panel, revealing a maz and circuit breakers. Only someone with an intimate knowl sub could posslbly find the right one. Owens does quickly switch, shuts the panel. He turns, sees their anxious loo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that takes care of the valve. It was probably caused by that electric shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Owens) Was there any damage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to the valve. But we've lost too much air to make it the rest of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you propose we do, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing we can do. We must have full tanks to continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts up toward the Bubble, leaving the three staring other in consternation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grant slips out of the seat and Owens resumes at contr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any reserve air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough to breathe, but that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant starts down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps into the cabin in time to hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironically) Just a few cells away from a vast air chamber -- one of the countless Alvioli of the Lung -- and we can't get enough to fill a microscopic tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can... (as they look at him in bewilderment) Skipper, is there a snorkel on this sub?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Bubble) Yes, there is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michaels and Duval) Could I run a tube through that Wall, without harming Benes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this size, I would certainly think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If those Corpuscles can take on air, no reason why we can't. (to Duval) All we have to do is hook up the snorkel to that air chamber you were talk1ng about, and when Benes inhales, there should be plenty of pressure to force the oxygen into the tank. (up at Owens) How's that sound to you, Skipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Owens considers the possibility:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dangerous procedure. If I miss the timing, we could explode the tanks... But I'm willing to try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, by all means. We must try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Bubble) It'll be safer if everybody leaves the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant moves to the aft compartment, opens the door, goes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he moves to compartment containing the Underwater Gear jolted by something he sees o.s.

dialogues.speaker: LASER OVER WORKING COUNTER
dialogues.text: It is swinging loose on one hook, its plastic cover off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant takes a step toward it, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cora!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, she appears. She follows his look toward reacts aghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you didn't batten it down too well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I did. I'm positive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duval and Michaels appear in the doorway in time to hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how come it worked loose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cora, is something wrong with the laser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distraught) I don't know yet, Doctor. And I won't know until I test it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll have to wait until after we're refueled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he takes out the Underwater Gear and passes it to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (righting laser) I can't imagine how it possibly could have come loose. I distinctly recall fastening it with all four bolts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must have been jarred loose during the whirlpool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Michaels exchange looks, as if neither are sati the explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of gear) Well, let's get into these as quickly as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads the way out. Michaels and Duval follow. Left alo starts to unzip her jumper, revealing she is wearing her beneath. Her eyes remain on the laser, now her prime sour anxiety...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting on the grid map, we see the sub in the channel o Pulmonary Artery. CAMERA then TILTS DOWN to the Radarscop blip is blinking on and off in one place, without moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor at the Map Table, we see the INTERIOR OF T POST, where the same blip is in the identical stationary the Radarscreen. PULL BACK to include Reid staring at the monitor. Carter is pacing on the other side of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've stopped -- on the outer limits of the Right Lung...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter looks at the Minute Recorder. It reads <42>.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another delay... With only forty-two minutes left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be close -- but there's still a margin of safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's find what the devil's holding them up! (to Wireless Technician) Contact the Proteus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the message is heard being tapped out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at Monitors; none are on) It must be some kind of mechanical difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tapping stops. As they wait for an answer, Carter pou of sugar into his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to cut down on the sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it. I'm just weak, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All have stepped out of their jumpers and are now reveale swim suits except Owens, who remains in the Bubble. The s form-fitting, antiseptic-looking, with a Breather Pack st back. Duval is tightening Cora's pack. Grant is checking pack. The latter looks in rear at the small hatch, visibl open door. The wireless starts tapping again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of tapping wireless) Shouldn't you answer that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting on swim mask) Not now. We need air, not greetings!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions Michaels to precede him into the hatch. Face r irrational fear, Michaels puts his swim mask over his fea freezes at the door, unable to step into the small hatch. Duval exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels forces himself into the Escape Hatch. Grant foll the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is only space for the two. Michaels cowers against palms pressed against the metal, fighting against another his phobia. Grant opens a valve. Liquid starts pouring in from several ports. When it is up to their chins, Grant b unlock the ventral hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant drops out of the hatch. Michaels follows. Grant the hatch. With Grant in the lead, they swim toward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant reaches the snorkel, looks toward Bubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Owens has now swiveled so that he faces the stern. Grant signal to proceed. Owens presses button on SNORKEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snorkel starts rising. When the tube is a few feet ab Grant takes the bobbing end, holds it under one arm, and swimming with his free arm toward the Capillary Wall on t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grant swims by with the end of the unreeling tube, Mic him. Then Duval and Cora, who are now coming out of the v All swim to the nearby Capillary Wall. (NOTE: During the their action is complicated by the big Corpuscles flowing steady stream, taking on oxygen and bumping into them.) T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shimmers with the liquid that seems to cover it like a reflecting glass. The opening is just large enough for al within. They see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast conical volcano, the upper part lost to view. Nume outcroppings of immense crags are visible on all sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's full of rocks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NOTE: During all Swimming Sequences, we will hear the Sp <only> via the AUDIO PICKUP within the swimming mask of t responds vocally.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a way -- yes. Those are impurities imbedded in the Lung after a lifetime of 'Civilization.' Carbon from smoke and smog -- specks of dust --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we better get on with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts shoving the front of the snorkel through the ve entrance. To his startled surprise, it immediately comes with great force. Michaels and Duval grab it in time to p snorkel from snaking off down the stream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful! There is a tremendous air pressure in there -- in relation to our size!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant grabs hold or the front part again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try to hold it from the other side of the wall, while you push from out here. Maybe that'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't --it's too dangerous --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- with all that pressure, and suction within --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no other way. Tie my safety line to the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant takes out his safety line, hooks it onto his suit. swimming with the other end back to the Proteus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens is eyeing the pressure gauges anxiously. He reacts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Owens we see Duval is nearing the sub, the safety li behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duval hooks Grant's safety line onto a ring for the purpo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant acknowledges signal. The Alveolar Wall can be seen slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right now -- push the snorkel through as soon as I get inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes on Wall) Walt for the lull -- between the time he inhales and exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the dilating stops:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: <Now>!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant pushes quickly through the shimmering entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has literally transposed himself into another element: is no turbulence, no sound. Instantly he props his feet a sides of the entrance. The snorkel is shoved through. As and holds, a breath is heard starting. Only Grant can hea sound.

dialogues.speaker: CAPILLARY SIDE OF ALVEOLUS
dialogues.text: Duval now joins Michaels and Cora. They hold against the pressure from within. Grant can be seen straining on the against the enormous wind pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens' finger is on the button of the MASTER PRESSURE GAU Tha indicator is quickly swinging toward FULL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind is rising to gale force. Grant is holding on wit strength to the end of the snorkel. The others can be see from their side, to keep the tube from flying out.

dialogues.speaker: MASTER PRESSURE GAUGE
dialogues.text: As the indicator hits the FULL position:

dialogues.speaker: AIR TANK CONTROL BUTTON
dialogues.text: Owens' finger presses down while:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Full!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In response, Grant lets go of the snorkel, which is insta out. Buffeted by the howling wind, he now tries to get ou hurricane causes Grant to lose his balance. He falls, sla the outcroppings by the force of the wind. Finally the lu Instantly, Grant starts climbing back, hand over hand, us as one would in scaling a mountain. The crevice is still when suddenly a new breath starts in the upward direction caught in the tremendous suction of the exhalation and is toward the interior of the Lung.

dialogues.speaker: SAFETY CLASP ON SUB RING
dialogues.text: The Safety Clasp breaks off at the end of the nylon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels, Duval and Cora react as the line snakes past th the crevice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified) He's gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suction sends Grant flying upward, past the crevice, safety line trailing after him. The wind whips him toward height. Finally he hits:

dialogues.speaker: COLUMNAR CILIA
dialogues.text: Long stalks, with a waving motion that makes it resemble of wheat. Grant is seen flying through it, until he is lo Then as the wind subsides:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three are waiting, tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michaels) What can we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing -- against all that force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we just can't leave him in there! What'll happen to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll know -- in the next breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They react as they see the Alveolar Wall starting to dila signaling the advent of another breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind starts howling. And then Grant is seen at a vast plummeting down. Part of the way he hits a spongy area, b caught up again by the blasting wind, hits another spongy with a big outcropping of "rock."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting the gale, he manages to snake his safety line ar rock. As he hangs on, he sees:

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPALS AND SUB
dialogues.text: Not too far above, with rocks between.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: He waits it out until the howling tornado subsides. Then he releases himself quickly and clambers toward the openi thrusts himself through the crevice, just as another brea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others grab him, pull him through all the way before sucked back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens is relieved to see the four start swimming back to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is pacing in the heavy silence. Reid is watching t Carter glances at the Minute Recorder. It flashes to <37> the tapping starts. Tense, they wait for the message. It the Wireless Operator tears it off the pad, Carter takes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) 'Proteus reports putting in to refuel air. Proceeding through the Pleural Cavity.' (suddenly realizing) Refuel air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Reid starts to remove the OVERLAY MAP OF THE HEART fro Radarscope:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? They had a choice of over a billion Alveoli...

dialogues.speaker: PROTEUS IN PLEURAL CAVITY
dialogues.text: The lone voyager is proceeding in a calm sea. Its headbea yellowish cast, which becomes increasingly warm and sunny scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens glances at the Repeater. The co-ordinates show the traveling toward the apex of the Pleura, to the north, wh bounded by an undefined area simply marked "Lymphatic." A absolute serenity seems to pervade. Abruptly:

dialogues.speaker: SMASHED LASER TRANSISTOR
dialogues.text: as it is placed on the edge of an array of disassembled p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cora is putting the tiny transistor down. Then, with a tw takes out the last part: a hair-like strand of wire. To D beside her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a broken trigger-wire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Michaels are standing at the doorway, reacting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fingering the parts) A smashed transistor. No way to fire the lamp... Well, that's the end of the laser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Michaels exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cora) You must carry spare parts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anything built into the chassis. (with guilt) If it hadn't come loose --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's beside the point now. (to Duval) I don't see the sense of going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With no laser --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Duval) Isn't there another surgical procedure you can try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, there's no other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Michaels can answer, Grant squeezes into the compa up the broken transistor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cora) If you had a transistor about this size and power output, and a thin enough wire -- (of laser) -- could you piece it together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it requires such absolute precision --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surgeon might...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, I'm sure Dr. Duval could. If we had the parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a source. All I have to do is tap it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At their blank looks, he turns and moves into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he goes to the wireless and begins to unscrew the pane suddenly realizes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant -- wait a minute -- you're not going to dismantle the wireless?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one little transistor and a circuit wire is all it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that'll knock out our communications! We'll be cutting ourselves off from the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll still be able to track us by radar, because of the radioactive fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the panel, revealing a maze of electronic par

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir? Which is it? The wireless, or Benes' life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) Send the following message...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LUNG OVERLAY MAP is now on the Radarscope. Reid and Car Grid Officer is moving the replica of the Proteus into th quadrant of the Pleural Cavity. An incoming message is heard. The Wireless Operator takes message. As the tapping stops:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) 'Cannibalizing wireless to repair laser. This is last message.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid and Carter exchange grim looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incommunicado... Now they're really on their own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid moves to the window overlooking the OPERATING ROOM. down on Benes and the little Tracking Devices weaving bac across his chest:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) We can still track them -- but that's all we can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter joins him. As they both look down:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something told me I got into the wrong end of the bus1ness. (answering look) <Inner> Space...

dialogues.speaker: TINY TRANSISTOR AND STRAND OF WIRE
dialogues.text: In the palm of Grant's hand. Cora's fingers delicately pi CORAlS VOICE (o.s.) The transistor will do. But the wire's much too thick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duval is picking up the original wire with the tweezers a on a contrasting surface during:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cora turns to the workbench:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may be able to scrape it thin enough. Cora, get me a number eleven scalpel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the transistor and wire down on the workbench an open a medical kit. Duval takes the wire and places it be small clamps on the workbench. Cora extracts a scalpel, g him. Duval swings a magnifying glass over the strand as C light on the wire. Duval bends over. Peering through the glass, he slowly begins to scrape the strand with the sca

dialogues.speaker: GRANT AND MICHAELS
dialogues.text: They exchange looks. Then Grant turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant leads the way to the bow. As they look out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the sea, at dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're safe -- long as it remains that color... (answering look) We're in the Pleural Sac. (indicating arched dome far above) It keeps the Lungs from rubbing against the Wall of the Chest up there. When those membranes become inflamed, we wind up with Pleurisy -- and a wracking cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cough? If he can kick up a storm by just <breathing> --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Pleura's in fine condition. It should be clear sailing through this area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope... So far, somebody's tried to sabotage this mission twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances back in the direction of Duval. Both drop thei that Duval and Cora can't hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Sabotage? I don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the laser just before we started. It was fastened down securely. You don't suppose what happened was an 'accident?' Any more than my safety line snapping after it was tied off to the sub?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no right to blame Duval --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That line was tampered with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated) I -- I don't know what to say. I know he's under a cloud, but there's not a more dedicated man in the entire medical profession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still never know what's going on in anyone's mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with finality) I can't believe it. Whatever happened was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two in a row?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks at the Minute Recorder. It now reads <32>.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-two minutes left... (back to Michaels) But chances are we won't have to wait that long for try-number three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above) Look at those Walls up ahead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Michaels look out through the bow. Grant reacts sees:

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE OF LYMPHATIC DUCT
dialogues.text: A huge tube-like structure looms up. The Walls are transp composed of a single layer of squamous cells with round n the color of the stream is now predominately yellow, the the impression of innumerable:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) <Poached eggs>?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Michaels moves to the console:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with smile) We're entering the Lymphatic System. Those are nuclei of cells, lining a Duct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) I always had an idea there was only one System. The Circulatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lymphatic System drains off excess fluid from the Tissues. Without it, we'd all swell up like balloons. He reaches the console, begins to take out a new chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new chart suddenly becomes visible on the Repeater as out below. Owens reacts to the labyrinth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like quite a Navigation problem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The co-ordinates are seen being moved to indicate the sub through a Lymphatic Duct on its way to the first Node, wh followed by a series of others, strung out like sausage l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from below) Only until we get through the Nodes -- the Lymphatic Glands. Follow your present compass heading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it courses easily through the sunny stream, to suddenl into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A startlingly different world. The headbeams reveal what an underwater marshland: a tangle of reticular fibers whi the gentle cross currents seeping through the mesh. Weird forms drift by, moving in groups like raiding parties. Th light of the Lymphatic Stream still filters through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens is forced to slow down as he carefully begins to th through the tangle, trying not to brush against the tendr all of Owens' care, the nose of the sub breaks some fiber nudges through the increasingly narrow spaces of the bram

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant reacts as he sees the broken fibers drift against t windows, and then become momentarily entangled around the tendrils clear the windows, he looks back to the stern.

dialogues.speaker: FLOATING TENDRILS
dialogues.text: They are floating aft. Some adhere to the propulsion sect out so that Grant can see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant reacts, looks back and up toward Bubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper, you're picking up seaweed -- or whatever it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuringly; at chart) Reticular fibers. We ought to be clear of them soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Owens, we see the way ahead is more tangly. As he ke down to get through safely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously) I hope so, Doctor. If that stuff clogs the vents, the engine'll overheat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks off as a big clump of fibers is torn loose, for skillful steering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mass of tendrils drifts down the length of the unders the clump adheres to the ventral hatch, another section t the exhaust: In so doing, it snags on the brambles beneat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scalpel poised over the wire, Duval reacts as the Proteus jars while it pulls loose. He exchanges looks with Cora, holding the lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant glances back toward the open door of the aft compar realizing the danger of trying to repair the laser now. H Michaels, who is bent over the chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is interrupted by a loud WHAM against the bow windows. both look off, see:

dialogues.speaker: ANTIBODIES
dialogues.text: Flashing reflected light from the headbeams, elongated cr structures with rod-like projections which make linkage p whipping against the bow windows where they have trapped ferocious-looking large Bacteria. The smaller crystalline are rapidly coupling with others that speed in to join th Bacteria fight back with their flagella, in a death strug

dialogues.speaker: VIEW OF BATTLE FROM INT. BUBBLE
dialogues.text: Owens ducks involuntarily as the linking Antibodies and t slam against the Bubble in such numbers and sizes as to m ahead virtually invisible. As a result, the sub tears thr of fibers like a scythe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duval appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's causing all that -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks off as he sees the Antibodies and Bacteria whip the windows. Cora appears behind him, gasps at the sight monsters locked in battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like somebody declared war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what it is. Antibodies, destroying Bacteria -- or any other foreign invader that threatens the System.

dialogues.speaker: ONE ANTIBODY AND BACTERIUM
dialogues.text: As both slam and hold against the bow windows in a life-a struggle. An amazing phenomenon is taking form: Antibodie up at the rods to completely encase the Bacterium -- and forms fit the antagonist <perfectly>.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Look -- it's taking its exact shape!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Like hand-in-glove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Much closer. Like two atoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the crystalline geometric links start pressing togeth inexorable force. The Bacterium fights back with its flag suddenly it goes limp. As the destroyed Bacterium drifts mass of virulent monsters smashes into the windows and ar embattled with a swarm of Antibodies that come linking up SOUND of the battle can be heard along the entire length Meanwhile, the sub is jarred hard, as it breaks through a of entangling fibers. The sound and sight of the mortal b increases in intensity, as does the forced passage during

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with glance at Minute Recorder) We'll never get there in time, at this rate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to M1chaels) Isn't there another route? So we can by-pass all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... (to Michaels) We can transfer over to the Inner Ear, and go by way of the Endolymphatic Duct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to M1chaels) Then why not take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's infinitely more hazardous than going this way. Once we enter the Inner Ear, <any> sound in the Operating Room will be disastrous. At our reduced size, the vibrations inside the Ear would have a shattering effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another jar of the sub, and more smashing against the hul windows, as the battle of the Antibodies and Bacteria rea climax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over sound) They're tracking us Topside. Once they see where we're going, I'm sure they'll take every precaution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope they realize the danger. (up at Bubble) Captain, I'll give you a new compass heading.

dialogues.speaker: BENES' SHAVED HEAD
dialogues.text: With the radial lines in the f.g. Beyond, the Tracking De weaving back and forth in the area of the Neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA on the TRACKING POST, PICKING UP the Four Technici their Radarscreens. CAMERA then TILTS UP to the big grid the Grid Officer above, positioning the replica of the Pr Inner Ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid and Carter are looking down at the OPERATING ROOM. T the Communications Aide announces:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proteus turning in Quadrant 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid and Carter move to window overlooking the MAIN OPS R exchange relieved looks as the Grid Officer moves the sub lateral quadrant, in the Neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with relief) At last they're heading for the Inner Ear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter glances at the Minute Recorder. It flashes <27>.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (biting into unlit cigar) About time they realized they'd never make it the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid moves to the Control Section, presses button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Surgical Team and the Technicians exchange looks as t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) The Proteus is about to enter the Inner Ear... You are not to walk, talk, or make a sound of <any> kind. (strongly) <Absolute silence> must be maintained until they are out of the danger area...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As all remain frozen in their positions:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with it to:

dialogues.speaker: BENES' EAR
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES IN on the Ear, until it fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red warning lights are flashing, the needle of the TE GAUGE is in the danger zone. The SPEEDOMETER is nearing z

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens is working the controls, apparently without avail. anxiously ahead, sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge clear area. In the distance, a few drifting Antibo is nothing evident that should be giving the Proteus any

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Owens looks back with grave concern to the panel, the needle drops to zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Proteus is sinking to the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duval and Cora are back in the lab Section, working on th Grant is beside Michaels at the chart. Both look up as th touches bottom with a slight jar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (up at Bubble) What's wrong, Skipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Bubble) What I was afraid would happen. The stuff we passed through -- that looked like seaweed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reticular fibers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Bubble) It clogged the intake vents. We're not getting any propulsion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's only one thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he moves to put on his Breather Pack, Cora appears in of the Lab Section. She looks anxiously out of the bow wi distance, several Anti-bodies can be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going out there? With those Antibodies --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Grant) No danger of attack, as long as you don't trigger them off by any injury to the System.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant nods, steps into the Escape Hatch, closing the door The light flashes red. Cora remains at the bow windows, l the drifting Anti-bodies, with apprehension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is dropping out of the opening, causing the attache like fibers to come loose and drift off.

dialogues.speaker: WITH GRANT
dialogues.text: He swims toward the bow, reaches the propulsion intake ve clogged vents come into view:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over audio) How's it look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could use a lawnmower...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens glances at the Minute Recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you think it'll take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over audio) Quite a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cora turns from the bow windows. The Antibodies are still

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't it be quicker if we all helped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with glance at Minute Recorder) Yes, there's no time to spare. And those fibers can be quite tenacious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the Escape Hatch with Cora, both strapping on Breather Packs. She glances at Duval, still in the Lab Se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better use the time to finish repairing the laser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels and Cora step into the Escape Hatch, adjust thei masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is pulling the seaweed-like fibers out of the intak works fast at what seems an endless task.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens is watching the TEMPERATURE GAUGE. The needle is st danger zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels and Cora swim up to Grant, join him in yanking o clinging tendrils. All work quickly as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolute silence. The immobile Surgical Team and Technici tableau-like effect. The forced silence and the inactivit several to sweat with tension. All are focusing on the Tr Devices, now weaving back and forth at Benes' Head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid and Carter are at the window overlooking the OPERATI Communications Aide turns to them. They react with misgiv hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report no movement of the Proteus since entering Quadrant 74, Level D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid and Carter exchange grim looks, move to look down on ROOM. They see the little Proteus is in the quadrant of t Duct. Carter glances at the Minute Recrder. It now reads

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-four minutes left. Maximum. This is just what we need -- another delay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees an ant crawling along the table, in the direction spilled grains of sugar. Automatically, he starts to brin down to crush it. But he stops just in time. Reid looks a curiously as the latter carefully picks up the ant and pu railing so it can crawl out of harm's way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with smile) You'll wind up a Hindu. Respecting all forms of life -- however small...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loose tendrils are flowing about the hull like drifting s the vents seem to hold an endless amount. Grant, Cora and working at an exhausting pace, keep pulling out more and of long fibers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes on the TEMPERATURE GAUGE, Owens reacts with relief a needle beginning to swing away from the danger zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing moves except the little Tracking Devices on their bearings. But the ordeal of absolute silence and no movem beginning to tell on all. Particularly:

dialogues.speaker: SURGICAL CHIEF
dialogues.text: An older man, corpulent, he is sweating profusely under t The headband of his Surgical Cap is wet. Automatically, h rubber-gloved hand up to wipe the perspiration away, stop glances at the patient o.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many loose tendrils now about the hull attest to the prog cleaning the vents. The three keep working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The needle of the TEMPERATURE GAUGE is now almost out of zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub is not moving. The Minute Recorder reads <21>.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid and Carter are at the window, looking down into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the fiber clumps is now being removed.

dialogues.speaker: SURGICAL CHIEF
dialogues.text: Rivulets of sweat are streaming down toward the wrinkled his eyes, causing him to blink.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE SURGICAL AIDE
dialogues.text: Seeing his extreme discomfort, she follows the usual proc reaching for a towel on the instrument table.

dialogues.speaker: TOWEL
dialogues.text: A surgical scissors is partially tucked within the folds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scissors is not visible from the Aide's angle. As she towel gently off the table, careful not to make a sound:

dialogues.speaker: SCISSORS
dialogues.text: Dislodged from the table. CAMERA WHIPS with it toward the the shattering impact:

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: It fills the screen, the sound reverberating o.s. Instant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vibrations send the Proteus flying through the clear struck by a cataclysmic undersea force. (NOTE: Until the sequence, the vibrations keep on as if they have set off reverberations in endless echo chambers.)

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Flung in one direction.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAELS
dialogues.text: Hurled off in another direction.

dialogues.speaker: CORA
dialogues.text: Whipped away from all the others.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS IN BUBBLE
dialogues.text: Clutching the panel for support.

dialogues.speaker: DUVAL IN LAB SECTION
dialogues.text: Clutching the laser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she is tossed toward the Cells of Hensen: a series of structures, non-rigid, with cuticular plates forming a mo

dialogues.speaker: CORA
dialogues.text: She is horrified as she sees where she is heading for:

dialogues.speaker: CHASM
dialogues.text: One wall consists of the TECTORIAL MEMBRANE, opaque, with huge fibers. The other wall: geometric and translucent. S intervals are what appear to be electrical conduits with strands spanning the two walls. All the conduits are vibr

dialogues.speaker: WITH CORA
dialogues.text: She is thrust over the curved edge, starts falling head d narrowly misses the first connective conduit. Then her Br snags on one of the strands of the next conduit, which fl partially to one side so that her legs are caught between strands. As she hangs head down, the weight of her body c strands -- and herself -- to be whipped back and forth, s terrifled to see: 486        LONG SHOT - CHASM - CORA'S P.O.V. All the quadruple strands are vibratlng in the seemingly abyss.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO CORA
dialogues.text: As she tries to extricate herself, which causes her to be with even greater intensity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the Proteus is being brought under contr and Grant are in view, swimming against the force set off diminishing vibrations in this part of the Ear.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: He hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible: over audio) Please! Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks about. There is no sign of her.

dialogues.speaker: CORA
dialogues.text: Struggling head down, in terror, she hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over audio; in distance) Cora! Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! I think I'm caught on some auditory fibers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels swims up to Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Michaels points, Grant hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over audio) Right down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both swim off in the indicated direction, reach:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both look down. At first they don't see her. Then Grant s points for Michaels' benefit. They see: 493        CORA IN CHASM - THEIR P.O.V. Far below, still trying to struggle loose.

dialogues.speaker: CORA IN CHASM
dialogues.text: As she hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on audio) Okay! I can see you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops struggling. But unseen by her, the vibrating st which she is entangled have called forth, in apparent res

dialogues.speaker: FEW ANTIBODIES
dialogues.text: Appearing from the far side, and below Cora. They start m her. More Antibodies instantly appear from the same area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Michaels are swimming over the curved mosaic ce

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CHASM
dialogues.text: Grant and Michaels swim down toward Cora on the strands. Antibodies become visible, gathering in increasing number stream up toward Cora. They are as yet unlinked, but she unmistakably their target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Antibodies!... Coming at Cora! She's triggered them off!

dialogues.speaker: CORA ON STRANDS
dialogues.text: From her head-down position, she sees: 500        LONG SHOT - ANTIBODIES - CORA'S P.O.V. Streaming upward in increasing numbers toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor! Get back in the sub! Quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels starts swimming fast as he can toward the Proteu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is racing to reach Cora before they do.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE AUDITORY STRANDS
dialogues.text: From her head-down position, Cora sees vast numbers of: A now nearer. Frantic with fear, she tries to free herself, strands to start vibrating again, which calls forth more stream out of the far side. Grant reaches her, starts wor desperately to get her loose. She tries to help as he yan Breather Pack, trying to work it off the wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the edge of the chasm. Duval is seen at the bow wind out anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duval turns as the door of the Escape Hatch opens from wi Michaels steps out. He closes the door quickly. The light instantly flashes red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Michaels pulls off his swimming mask, breathing hard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below the Cells of Hensen. If those Antibodies reach her, they'll attack as if she were bacteria...

dialogues.speaker: ANTIBODIES
dialogues.text: They are beginning to link up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is still trying to get her Breather Pack loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (franticaliy) Hurry! Oh please, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He manages to get her pack loose, now starts pulling the at her ankles so that she can extricate herself. As she f they execute a half-somersault in the stream to start swi Both get a fleeting look at:

dialogues.speaker: ANTIBODIES
dialogues.text: The links have now formed chains the <exact length> of Co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant grabs her at the torso and starts to propel her upw

dialogues.speaker: CHASM
dialogues.text: The long links, in vast numbers, now race after the frant swimming Cora and Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Cora appear, swim over the slippery edge of the cells. She is too exhausted to keep up the pace. Grant ho one arm as he keeps swimming toward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duval and Michaels can be seen at the bow windows, lookin is visible within the Bubble, peering out anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two reach it, Grant still helping Cora. They are at t exhaustion. Grant reacts as he sees:

dialogues.speaker: LIGHT OVER VENTRAL HATCH
dialogues.text: Flashing red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant waits, hand at the wheel. Cora looks back toward th chasm for signs of the Antibodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) Open it! Open it before they get here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't till the hatch is flooded!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At her look of fright, he turns and sees:

dialogues.speaker: ANTIBODIES
dialogues.text: The long links catapult over the edge of the chasm like P missiles in flight, then begin to execute a turn for a ma in the direction of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light flashes green. Grant begins turning the wheel q can.

dialogues.speaker: ANTIBODIES
dialogues.text: Hurtling down toward Cora, and the wheel turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the door drops down, the vanguard of the Anti-bod Cora. Two coils whip transversely around her shoulders. T time to tear them off. Grant thrusts Cora through the doo follows, with the massed attackers streaming in after the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cora is clawing at the Antibodies which are coiling aroun every direction. For the moment, Grant can't help her as to close the door against:

dialogues.speaker: ANTIBODIES AT VENTRAL DOOR
dialogues.text: The crystalline links are forcing their way in, against t of the closing door. Grant struggles with all his strengt coiling mass. Finally he manages to get the door closed a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water level starts falling, accompanied by the hissin pressure. Grant and Cora try to claw at the crystalline s But in the extremely narrow confines of the chamber, ther either can do. Suddenly Cora's expression changes to one pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) They're tightening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desperately, Grant tries to get at least one coil loose, avail. The crystalline structures are now constricting ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duval and Michaels stand before the Escape Hatch, waiting light to change to green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (up at Bubble) How much longer?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above) Ten seconds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too long!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to twist the wheel, to open the Hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water is now down to their knees. Grant is still pull the many links around Cora, but without any effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible) Please -- I -- can't -- can't breathe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she is cut off as all the Antibodies lock into place. remains open, in the manner of someone being choked to de crystalline coils about her body give her the appearance Laocoon... Suddenly the entrance door is thrust open behi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water pours out from the Escape hatch as Grant drags Cora falls on the floor. Duval and Michaels instantly start pu Antibodies. Cora is almost unconscious. Grant joins in th effort to free her. And then Owens, who comes bounding do Bubble. All four men pull at the structures with all thei And suddenly they begin to break off, shattering into cry fragments. With some coils broken, the others soon lose t adhesion. Finally Cora is free. As soon as she finds her begins to cry hysterically. Duval bends over, calming her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All are still immoblle, sweating out the long wait. The F Surgical Aide who caused the scissors to drop stands hold towel. The scissors is still on the floor at her feet. In she carefully reaches out and dabs at the rivulets of swe down the Head Surgeon's face. Now all are concentrating o

dialogues.speaker: DEVICES
dialogues.text: Moving silently back and forth across Benes' head, the on with what is transpiring within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid is looking down into the OPERATING ROOM, Carter is p fresh cups of coffee. At the SOUND of a warning buzz, bot TV monitor. They see the INTERIOR OF THE TRACKING POST. T moving on the radar screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proteus proceeding toward Quadrant 75...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid takes the coffee which Carter extends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) On their way again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter glances at the Minute Recorder. It now reads <12>. empty sugar container without looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve minutes left -- (breaks off; sees no sugar) Of all the time to run out of sugar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Proteus is speeding through the very wide passage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michaels is spreading out a chart of the Brain, with the Duval. As the complexity comes into view, Grant reacts. W the Minute Recorder:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like quite a way to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
